org.baswell.httproxy
Interface ProxyDirector

All Known Subinterfaces:
IOProxyDirector, NIOProxyDirector
All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleIODirector, SimpleNIOProxyDirector, SimpleProxyDirector
public interface ProxyDirector

Base interface for receiving proxy events and manipulating request & response headers. All implementations of this interface must be thread-safe.

Method Detail

getBufferSize

int getBufferSize()
Returns:
The size in bytes of the read buffer.

onRequestStart

ConnectionParameters onRequestStart(HttpRequest httpRequest)
                                    throws EndProxiedRequestException
Before the given HTTP request is sent to the server. The HTTP request (status line and headers) can be modified here before it is sent to the server.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request.
Returns:
The server connection the given httpRequest will be proxied to. If null is a returned a 404 will be returned to the client.
Throws:
EndProxiedRequestException - To return the provided HTTP status and message and end the proxied the httpRequest.

onConnectionFailed

void onConnectionFailed(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                        ConnectionParameters connectionParameters,
                        java.io.IOException e)
Notification when a connection was unable to be established.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request this connection failed on.
connectionParameters - The connection parameters previously return from onRequestStart(HttpRequest).

onRequestEnd

void onRequestEnd(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                  ConnectionParameters connectionParameters)
After the given HTTP request has been sent to the server (including body). Modifying the given HTTP request here will have no impact as the request has already been sent.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request sent to the server.
connectionParameters - The connection parameters used for the server.

onResponseStart

void onResponseStart(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                     HttpResponse httpResponse)
Before the given HTTP response is sent back to the client.. The HTTP response (status line and headers) can be modified here before it is sent back to the client.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request that produced the given response.
httpResponse - The HTTP response.

onResponseEnd

void onResponseEnd(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                   HttpResponse httpResponse)
After the given HTTP response has been sent to the client (including body). Modifying the given HTTP response here will have no impact as the response has already been sent.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request that produced the given response.
httpResponse - The HTTP response.

onRequestHttpProtocolError

void onRequestHttpProtocolError(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                java.lang.String errorDescription)
Called when a HTTP request could not be correctly parsed.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request. May be null.
errorDescription - A description of the protocol error.

onResponseHttpProtocolError

void onResponseHttpProtocolError(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                 HttpResponse httpResponse,
                                 java.lang.String errorDescription)
Called when a HTTP response could not be correctly parsed.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request that produced the given response.
httpResponse - The HTTP response. May be null.
errorDescription - A description of the protocol error.

onPrematureRequestClosed

void onPrematureRequestClosed(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                              java.io.IOException e)
Called when the client connection was closed before the HTTP request was fully read or the response was returned.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request. May be null.
e - The IO exception that signaled the close.

onPrematureResponseClosed

void onPrematureResponseClosed(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                               HttpResponse httpResponse,
                               java.io.IOException e)
Called when the server connection was closed before a response was retrieved.

Parameters:
httpRequest - The HTTP request that produced the given response.
httpResponse - The HTTP response. May be null.
e - The IO exception that signaled the close.

getLogger

ProxyLogger getLogger()
The logger used by the HttProxy runtime.

Returns:
A logger or null to disable logging.
